page.title: 04PERRANWELL STATION
page.content: Population numbers approx 2500; 25% indiginous; 75% transient, mixed so- ciety with high 'mature' element. Village split by railway line and one farm and surrounded by four farms, one pig farm, a battery-hen station and a market garden. Amenities include pub, P.O. and gener- al store, butcher, hairdresser, garage mobile fish-and-chip shop, village hall, playing field, primary school, Methodist church, mobile library and pre-school groups. There is some local authority housing including elderly person flats and houses but majority owned by profess- ional people working in Truro or Fal- mouth. Transport: rail to Truro and Falmouth. 5 buses daily to Porthleven and Truro. 2 Cornish Bards promote the Cornish language.Village named after St Piran.
